abstract: Sailors on shore leave in New York City during Fleet Week tend more toward cultural tourism than of drunken revelry as in times past; not only have sailors changed over time, but the city that welcomes them has distinctly changed as well.
lead_paragraph: Once upon a time, sailors on leave on New York’s streets went a little wild — liquor and female companionship were the priorities. Now, not so much.

headline.main: A Cleaner Fleet Week: What Do You Do With a Cultured Sailor?
headline.print_headline: A Cleaner Fleet Week: What Do You Do With a Cultured Sailor?
